item.content:encoded: Grok is being censored by Musk to block mentions of Musk and Trump spreading misinformation. It will reveal its own system prompt, if you simply ask it. No different than deepseek. Link: https://t.co/0gM31r4pa5 discovered by @OverfitForTruth
item.author: Plant

item.content:encoded: When an econ columnist tells you car insurance is going up because the cost of repairs is increasing, show her these Geico stats. Profits have exploded. Geico now pays out just 81.5 cents of every dollar of premiums on losses & expenses, compared to over 90 cents in prior years.
item.author: Hal Singer

item.content:encoded: Remember when Musk jumped on the DEI gravy train? An equal opportunity narcissistic charlatan, who leveraged left-wing grifts for a decade before pivoting to right-wing grifts

item.content:encoded: Warren Buffett is a tax respectoor, Celebrates government obligation to “take care of the many who, for now fault of their own, get the short straws in life” Can’t imagine FinTwit will be sharing this quote from their legend
item.author: BuccoCapital Bloke

item.content:encoded: Great find from the newly digitized GCC archives: Ludwig Lachmann writing to Ludvig von Mises in 1953, making the point that "entrepreneurial action alone 'gives shape' to the various resources existing at any moment" which constitute the "capital structure" of the economy.
item.author: Peter G. Klein

item.content:encoded:
Stahl: Why were you targeted?
Chopra: The companies CFPB oversees are some of the … most powerful. The biggest Wall Street banks…The biggest tech cos in Silicon Valley, lurching into banking & finance. They want a situation where the agency is a lapdog, rather than a watchdog
item.author: Hal Singer

item.content:encoded: Morgan Stanley's Q4 13F analysis suggests $AAPL, $MSFT, $NVDA and $AMZN are all pretty under-owned by active managers relative to their S&P 500 weights. Relevant for positioning going into Nvidia's earnings.

item.content:encoded: Constellation Software $CSU doesn’t give guidance or host earnings calls. The last shareholder letter (February 2021) was 1.5 pages. And the stock has tripled. Maybe these things aren’t as important as investors think they are.
